intro: Pararuellia cavaleriei, commonly known as the Cavalerie's pararuellia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and elliptical, glossy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
